title: Édison Preciado
text:
Édison Andres Preciado Bravo (born April 18, 1986) is an Ecuadorian footballer currently playing for Aviced FC.
Club career.
Preciado started his professional career at <a href="Audaz%20Octubrino">Audaz Octubrino</a> but was soon sold to <a href="Club%20Deportivo%20Cuenca">Deportivo Cuenca</a>. He played 3 seasons with Cuenca and was soon noted for his goal scoring ability. However, his real success was shown in the 2009 season. After Cuenca qualified for the <a href="Copa%20Libertadores%202009">Copa Libertadores 2009</a>, Preciado scored the only goal in a 1-0 home win against <a href="Club%20Atletico%20Boca%20Juniors">Boca Juniors</a>. He signed for Ecuadorian giants <a href="Club%20Deportivo%20El%20Nacional">El Nacional</a> on January 6, 2009
After two years in Mexican club <a href="Atletico%20San%20Luis">Atletico San Luis</a>, Preciado left the club in the summer 2015, as the parties couldn't agree on a contract extension. In July 2015, he returned to his former club <a href="Club%20Deportivo%20El%20Nacional">El Nacional</a>. In January 2016, Preciado moved to <a href="Delf%C3%ADn%20S.C.">Delfín SC</a>.
In January 2017, Preciado returned to <a href="Club%20Deportivo%20Cuenca">Deportivo Cuenca</a> where he played the next three years. In March 2020, he joined <a href="Gualaceo%20S.C.">Gualaceo SC</a>. In November 2020, Preciado joined <a href="Orense%20S.C.">Orense</a>.
In the summer 2021, Preciado joined Aviced FC.
